page.title: 03Employment
page.content: British Aerospace are probably the biggest employer in the area.The company used to be Follands and this is where the Gnat trainer was built. This jet was made famous by the Red Arrows aerobatic team.The works were then taken over by Hawker Siddeley company and now British Aerospace. The College of Air Training was an important employer and it was here that many of the world's pilots were trained but sadly the establishment has had to close. The land which includes the airstrips has been sold for redevelopment. Petters is a factory which used to make diesel engines but now it produces refrigeration units. There is an oil storage depot in the area but this does not employ many staff.
